Git Joabe

  I made my self-hosted "Github".
  Me and my friend Natan decided to create a game project together, and use git for the source control (obvious choice). But a game project requires a lot of images, audios, etc., and this kind of files are much heavier than text files.
  That's why Git lfs exists, it can handle large files in a git repository, keeping the repository lightweight.
  Github already has support for git-lfs, but it comes with a price, so thats why i decided to store my own self-hosted private Github, so then me and my friend could have a lot more free space available for using git-lfs (and also i could have an excuse for put new things in my home lab).
  That's why i made my own fork of Gitbucket project. Then i did a rollback to the 4.39 release on the git history, addedd some customization, and implemented in my home server.
  And that's it.
